This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=AFTERTHEWALL.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-12T11:23:22Z Josefin Graef 2015-03-12T11:23:17+00:00 2015-03-12T11:23:17+00:00 SEMINAR: "Whither German Memory?", Prof Bill Niven, IGS Birmingham, 25 March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;c7b20d0c.1503 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>the Institute for German Studies at the University of Birmingham warmly invites you to its final event this term, a seminar with eminent Professor Bill Niven (Nottingham Trent University) co-organised with the Department of Modern Languages (German Studies):<br><br>"Whither German Memory? Towards an Integrated Model of Remembering"<br><br>German memory appears to be at a crossroads: but what is on the other side? It is not that Germany is moving from a period of 'communicative' to 'cultural' memory, terms which are of limited value in themselves, let alone as explanatory paradigms in the current situation. Rather [...] Josefin Graef 2015-02-13T07:24:46+00:00 2015-02-13T07:24:46+00:00 SEMINAR: German Environmentalism in Perspective, Institute for German Studies, University of Birmingham, 24 February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;8a9f4bb4.1502 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>the Institute for German Studies (IGS) at the University of Birmingham would like to invite you to its upcoming seminar:<br><br>"The Greenest Nation on Trial: German Environmentalism in Perspective"<br><br>in co-operation with the Birmingham Seminar for Environmental Humanities (BISEMEH)<br><br>Germany enjoys a reputation as an exceptionally green country. It has won international acclaim for its strong Green Party, its influential NGOs, the phasing-out of nuclear power, and its support for renewable energy. Yet how do we write the history of German environmentalism, and what does this history mean for current challenges? Taking a broad view [...] Josefin Graef 2015-01-14T12:32:45+00:00 2015-01-14T12:32:45+00:00 Forthcoming events 2015 at the Institute for German Studies (IGS), University of Birmingham https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;60a05ae0.1501 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>the Institute for German Studies at the University of Birmingham is organising a number of seminars and panel discussions in 2015 which we hope might be of interest to some of you. Please find the complete list of events below.<br><br>Best regards,<br><br>Josefin Graef Josefin Graef 2014-12-08T11:00:43+00:00 2014-12-08T11:00:43+00:00 SEMINAR: Randall Hansen, "Disobeying Hitler: German Resistance in the last year of WWII", IGS Birmingham, 10 December 2014, 5pm https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;b6473336.1412 Dear colleagues,<br><br>the Institute for German Studies (IGS) at the University of Birmingham would like to invite you to a talk by Professor Randall Hansen (University of Toronto) this Wednesday, 10th December, 5pm. He will present his thoughts on<br><br>"Disobeying Hitler: German Resistance in the last year of WWII", based on his recently published monograph (https://global.oup.com/academic/product/disobeying-hitler-9780199927920?cc=gb&lang=en&). [...] Josefin Graef 2014-11-29T22:59:22+00:00 2014-11-29T22:59:22+00:00 REMINDER: PhD Studentship - Institute for German Studies, University of Birmingham https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;4669e1f2.1411 PhD Studentship at the Institute for German Studies, University of Birmingham<br><br>Application deadline: 15th December 2014<br><br>The Institute for German Studies (IGS) at the University of Birmingham is seeking to support a three-year PhD Studentship as part of the DAAD-funded project: ‘(Not) Made in Germany: Imagining Germany from the Outside’<http://www.birmingham.ac.uk/research/activity/institute-german-studies/research/projects/from-the-outside.aspx>.<br><br>The successful candidate will complete a doctoral thesis on a topic related to the project and will provide administrative and research support to the project team. Opportunities to teach may become available in the second and final years of the doctoral studentship. The stipend attached to the studentship will be [...] Josefin Graef 2014-11-19T10:29:56+00:00 2014-11-19T10:29:56+00:00 REMINDER Seminar "The Dark Side of EU-rope: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdImperium Europaeum\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd?", IGS Birmingham, Monday 1 December 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;887dcbde.1411 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>you are warmly invited to attend the last event of our 2013/2014 research project "Weltanschauungen". This is a panel discussion entitled "The Dark Side of EU-rope: ‘Imperium Europaeum’?" bringing together the authors of two of the most exciting, cross-disciplinary recent publications on European integration in German to exchange ideas on the future development of the European Union: [...] Josefin Graef 2014-11-08T00:36:20+00:00 2014-11-08T00:36:20+00:00 Seminar "The Dark Side of EU-rope: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdImperium Europaeum\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd?", IGS Birmingham, Monday 1 December 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;72f8defd.1411 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>you are warmly invited to attend the last event of our 2013/2014 research project "Weltanschauungen". This is a panel discussion entitled "The Dark Side of EU-rope: ‘Imperium Europaeum’?" bringing together the authors of two of the most exciting, cross-disciplinary recent publications on European integration in German to exchange ideas on the future development of the European Union: [...] Josefin Graef 2014-10-13T10:54:09+00:00 2014-10-13T10:54:09+00:00 REMINDER Workshop: \ufffd\ufffd"The End of Stasiland?", Institute for German Studies Birmingham, 29 October 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;a4de8e67.1410 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>as part of its international research network - Weltanschauungen: The German Past and the Contemporary World - the Institute for German Studies invites you to a workshop under the title: "The End of Stasiland?", to be held on 29 October 2014, 2-7 p.m.<br><br>The aim of the event is to review both the history of the fall of the Berlin Wall and shifting representations of the GDR since 1989. [...] Anna Teresa Saunders 2014-06-05T12:36:03+00:00 2014-06-05T12:36:03+00:00 FW: Call for Papers "Die DDR im sozialen Ged\ufffd\ufffdchtnis \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd theoretische und empirische Zug\ufffd\ufffdnge\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, DGS-Arbeitskreis "Soziales Ged\ufffd\ufffdchtnis, Erinnern und Vergessen\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;3cdf292f.1406 Dear all,<br><br>The below/attached may be of interest to list members...<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Anna Josefin Graef 2014-05-13T17:02:28+00:00 2014-05-13T17:02:28+00:00 REMINDER: Seminar "Ethics and the Holocaust" - IGS Birmingham, 20th May 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;475c56ff.1405 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>the Institute for German Studies at the University of Birmingham warmly invites you to the next event of its major research project "Weltanschauungen. The German Past and the Contemporary World: The Domestic and Foreign Politics of Memory".<br><br>We are delighted to welcome Professor Marc Silberman and Justin Court from the University of Wisconsin-Madison to Birmingham. [...] Sybille Frank 2014-05-10T15:41:33+02:00 2014-05-10T15:41:33+02:00 CFP Heritage Outside In https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;45218a87.1405 Call for papers for the Paper Session<br><br>\ufffd\ufffdHeritage Outside In\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Second Association of Critical Heritage Studies Conference, Australian<br>National University, Canberra, December 2-4, 2014 Session Organizers: Susan<br>Ashley (susan.ashley@northumbria.ac.uk) and Sybille Frank<br>(sybille.frank@tu-berlin.de)<br><br>Deadline: 1st June, 2014<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Session Abstract:<br><br>\ufffd\ufffdHeritage\ufffd\ufffd is one social imaginary used by people to define a collective<br>identity. But global flows of people, ideas and technologies (Appadurai,<br>1996) are challenging the nature and importance of established<br>group/community/national identities and \ufffd\ufffdauthorised\ufffd\ufffd heritage discourses.<br>This session seeks to address how perceptions of heritage are changing \ufffd\ufffd at<br>a time when collective identities are being re-negotiated \ufffd\ufffd by [...] Josefin Graef 2014-05-05T14:04:00+00:00 2014-05-05T14:04:00+00:00 REMINDER: Exhibition "Dictatorship and Democracy in the Age of Extremes", 5-16 May 2014, Institute for German Studies, University of Birmingham https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AFTERTHEWALL;d2a6e843.1405 *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>the Institute for German Studies at the University of Birmingham, in partnership with Bundesstiftung zur Aufarbeitung der SED-Diktatur, Berlin, presents an exciting new exhibition:<br><br>‘DICTATORSHIP AND DEMOCRACY IN THE AGE OF EXTREMES: SPOTLIGHTS ON THE HISTORY OF EUROPE IN THE TWENTIETH CENTURY’.<br><br>Monday 5th to Friday 16th May 2014, 9.00 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 17.00<br>University of Birmingham, Muirhead Tower (Ground Floor Foyer),<br>Edgbaston, Birmingham, B15 2TT.
